_header: Upon the Rood I am for thee
Note:
Cf. Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no. 8884; for very similar lines see 2199, 3387, and 4275.
_description: Christ’s words from the cross — two couplets translating ‘In cruce sum pro te’ which precedes them in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Vpon þe rode I am for þeÞat þu sennest let for
                    meI þe for ȝeue lat ben þi strifbe knou þi senne
                    & amend þi lif
NLS18721.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 261.
